@burger.firm NW2 - 9.7/10 Ã°ÂŸÂ˜Â®Ã¢Â€ÂÃ°ÂŸÂ’Â¨Ã°ÂŸÂ”Â¥

A few weeks ago, I had the pleasure of being invited to The Burger Firm, a dark kitchen/ drive-in style burger spot and WOW - I was blown away by the food! 

I was kindly given the following menu items to try! 

Burgers:
4x4 (Ã‚Â£12.95)
The Good Burger (Ã‚Â£9.45)
Danny Dorito (Ã‚Â£10.95)
Eggslut (Ã‚Â£10.95)
FryÃ¢Â€Â™d Guy (8.45)
The Pandemic (Ã‚Â£12.95)

Fries:
FryÃ¢Â€Â™d Box (Chicken Loaded Fries) (Ã‚Â£9.95)

Milkshakes:
Oreo Melt Milkshake (Ã‚Â£6.45)
Nutty Professor Milkshake (Ã‚Â£6.45)

The 4x4 burger, consisting of 4 beef smash patties, was delicious, the aged mince really enhanced the flavour of the meat and the fat content was perfect, ensuring a juicy smash burger, whilst the crust made for the perfect bite. The sesame brioche bun kept the burger together, the sauce was the right amount, balanced in taste and the toppings complemented the burger really well. 

The Good Burger was in fact very good! 2 perfectly smashed beef patties, paired with their in house burger sauce and the same toppings as the 4x4 burger. If you canÃ¢Â€Â™t handle 4 patties, then this is for you! 

The Danny Dorito burger was a nice surprise! I have had burgers with tortilla chips in them, but too often they are stale and bland. This was not the case here - fresh chilli heatwave Doritos are crushed and top two smashed beef patties, alongside chopped turkey bacon, giving the burger an extra crunch and enhancing the flavour profile of this fantastic burger. 

The Eggslut burger worked really well- usually you may find a runny fried egg on a thick, large beef patty, however, the fried egg went really well with the smashed patties, and once again, the chopped turkey bacon made for a delicious burger. If you like a fried egg on your large, thick burgers, then this is a must try.
